X.T: Tinkertoy Models Produce New Geometric Insights
X.ST: Geometric objects take on different properties depending on the space in which you visualize them. Using techniques from an upstart field called tropical geometry — which analyzes complicated shapes using sticklike models — mathematicians have gained a new sense of how those properties behave.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Tropical geometry creates a link between shapes and chip-firing game.
The Nepal flag is defined mathematically.
Using circle inversion to compute the radius of the circles of a Pappus chain.
The "happy ending problem" and Erdős–Szekeres conjecture.

X.T: Without a Proof, Mathematicians Wonder How Much Evidence Is Enough

BLIST.TITLE:
Rational trigonometry:
This is bullshit.
Wildberger claims to have invented a new way to handle trigonometry, but this is just a rather simple rewrite of things known for a long time.
This may amuse a teenager interested by playing with mathematics.

X.T: An Invitation to Geometry | WildTrig: Intro to Rational Trigonometry 0 | N J Wildberger

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The introduction of the series and some advertisement for his book. He explains that some reasoning can be wrong because based on what we see on a drawing. He does such reasoning in the following videos…
